name: Introduction to Sociology
description: This course provides an introduction to the discipline of sociology. It covers the basic concepts and theories of sociology, and it examines how sociologists explain social behavior and social change.

name: Sociology of Social Inequality
description: This course focuses on the role of social inequality in the structure and functioning of societies. It examines the dynamics of inequality in economic, political, and social realms, and it discusses how inequality is maintained through social institutions.

name: Economic Sociology
description: This course offers an introduction to the field of economic sociology. It examines the ways in which economic processes are embedded in social and cultural contexts, and it explores the implications of economic sociology for understanding contemporary social phenomena.
